nodes.name: Topic
nodes.query: **Question**: Please use a phrase of three to five words to describe the topic studied in this paper.

nodes.name: Background
nodes.query: **Question**: Please describe the problem studied in this paper, why the problem is worth studying, and what are the issues of existing solutions to this problem.

item.name: problem_definition
item.description: The problem studied in this paper.

item.name: problem_value
item.description: Why the problem is worth studying.

item.name: existing_solutions
item.description: What are the existing solutions and their problems.

nodes.name: Contribution
nodes.query: **Question**: List all contributions of the paper. These contributions are always organized and listed with a head sentence like **our contributions are as follows**. For each contribution, output the **original representation** and use a few words to summarize it.

nodes.name: Challenge
nodes.query: **Question**: Please summarize some challenges in this paper. Each challenge has a summarized NAME, detailed DESCRIPTION, and SOLUTION.

output_schema.description: A list of challenges for the problems and their solutions in the paper.

item.name: name
item.description: The summarized name of the challenge.

item.name: solution
item.description: The solutions proposed for the challenge.

nodes.name: Solution
nodes.query: **Question**: Please present details of solutions that are proposed to solve the challenges in this paper. The solution can include system design, components of systems and algorithm details. Include as many details as possible for each solution.

output_schema.description: A list of solutions for the problem in this paper.

item.name: name
item.description: The summarized name of the solution.

item.name: description
item.description: The detailed description of the solution.

nodes.name: Experiment
nodes.query: **Question**: Please analyze details of experiments in this paper. The experiments are usually organized in a section named **Experiment** or **Evaluation**. Each experiment is typically a subsection of the whole experiment section. List each experiment with the name, settings including datasets, evaluation metrics, and baselines, and the results of the experiment. Provide the authors' analysis of the results, explaining why such results might have been observed and any implications. In addition, analysis for special cases can also be explained.

output_schema.description: A list of experiments in this paper.

item.name: settings
item.description: The settings of the experiment, including datasets, evaluation metrics, and baselines.

item.name: results
item.description: The results and their analysis of the experiment.

nodes.name: Baseline
nodes.query: **Question**: Please list the baselines compared with the method proposed in this paper. For each baseline, list its name and the name of the paper that first proposes this baseline. In detail, the paper that first proposes this baseline should be cited during the initial mentions of the baseline, and the name of the paper can be extracted from the references.

output_schema.description: A list of baselines in this paper.

item.name: paper_name
item.description: The name of the paper that first proposes this baseline.

nodes.name: Github
nodes.query: **Question**: Please list the github links provided in this paper. Those links always start with 'https://github.com/'. If there is no github link in this paper, return an empty list.

output_schema.description: A list of github links in this paper.

item.name: github
item.description: The github link in this paper.
